I'm about halfway through charting the punts for Week 1 (NFL Game Pass is really slowing me down) but I figured I'd start the Punt Shiny app up in the mean time. This will be updated and expanded with more stats using what I've collected soon! #nflverse

https://t.co/X6s6zvegV3 https://t.co/JKA7xVfDYT

Since 2000, there have been six games in which only four players were targeted in a game (the fewest amount in any game since then), per @nflfastR. #nflverse https://t.co/BJsk6yXPgx
Since 2000, the most targets that a player has recorded in a half is Tony Gonzalez with 17 in the second half of Week 17 of the 2004 season. #nflverse https://t.co/Tt8RVX5ncK

Best performing #NFL teams through Week 1 as represented by expected points added (EPA) for/against. For those unaware of EPA and how its used to evaluate aspects of team and player performance, check out the below post by the @The33rdTeamFB. #nflverse
